frame.name: Offshoot
frame.definition: <def-root>This frame refers to a part of an organization that becomes separate from the main body. The part is usually partially or even wholly autonomous, and may eventually become larger than the body from which it originated. <ex>Methodism is an an <t>offshoot</t> of the Church of England</ex> </def-root>

FE.name: Original_body
FE.definition: <def-root>The body from which the Offshoot is derived.</def-root>

FE.name: Branch
FE.definition: <def-root>The offshoot or branch of the original body which differs from it in some important respect.</def-root>

FE.name: Place
FE.definition: <def-root>The place in which the <fen>Branch</fen> is locate or where it first forms.</def-root>

FE.name: Time
FE.definition: <def-root>The time at which the <fen>Branch</fen> forms or thrives.</def-root>
